Hi dear

It is not required to test the private methods seperately.Becoz as=
 u 
said you got all the public methods to test in junit suite.

so we will=
 be calling the private methods in public methods.SO we will 
get the cover=
age of the private methods as well.

for example

public void multiply(){
p=
rotected int multiplyX,multiplyY,multiplyZ;

setters ....

getters...

mult=
iplyZ=3DmultiplyXY(multiplyX,multiplyY);

}

private int multiplyXY(int x,i=
nt y){
int mulXY;

mulXY=3Dx*y;

return mulXY;
}


so if you test the publi=
c method multiply that says the private method 
is also tested

ok revert m=
e for furthur clarifications

Regards

kadaru
